content.description: A half dozen or so independent lines on a squat bluff with a soft gravel bar landing. Solid (for Sedona standards) water polished stone that climbs surprisingly well. Surely this area has seen attention over the years so don’t think you’re doing anything new or special. The ground height is likely to change following flood events. Potential for eliminates abound. Worth an hour or two when you don’t want to work hard on an approach.

In a world of convoluted approaches and endless choss, this little sector of solid rock is a welcome sight. A small squat bluff of water polished sandstone above a soft gravel bar. What this outcrop lacks in height it makes up for with technical face and slab climbing. Given the short and easy approach, north facing aspect, and minimal Sedona choss, this small sector deserves some attention.
